data.name: PageTitle
data.value: ABOUT TEXAS CHICKEN

data.name: IntroHeading
data.value: INTRODUCTION

data.name: BrandTitle
data.value: TEXAS CHICKEN

data.name: BrandParagraph1
data.value: Founded in San Antonio, Texas (USA) in 1952, Texas Chicken is one of the world’s leading fast food service brands. Today, Texas Chicken is a top international fried chicken brand, serving over 3 million guests weekly at more than 1,700 restaurants in the USA and 26 other countries around the world.

data.name: BrandParagraph2
data.value: Texas Chicken is committed to using only the freshest, highest-quality chicken – never frozen. All dishes are freshly prepared every day and served hot and crispy to satisfy every guest.

data.name: BrandParagraph3
data.value: Entering the Vietnamese market in late 2012, Texas Chicken has rapidly expanded with 30 restaurants in Ho Chi Minh City, Binh Duong, Nha Trang, Hanoi, Hai Phong, and Bien Hoa, attracting many customers to experience its flavorful and bold “Texas-style” fried chicken.

data.name: TimelineIntro
data.value: HOW IT ALL STARTED

data.name: Timeline1950_1
data.value: His name was George W. Church, Sr., and he is the reason you crave chicken so much...

data.name: Timeline1950_2
data.value: George W. Church, Sr. opened Church's Fried Chicken-To-Go in downtown San Antonio...

data.name: Timeline1950_3
data.value: Churchie™ became the adorable mascot of the brand.

data.name: Timeline1960_1
data.value: Church's® had over 100 restaurants across seven states.

data.name: Timeline1960_2
data.value: George W. (Bill) Church, Jr. took over the company after his father's passing.

data.name: Timeline1960_3
data.value: Church's® became a public company. The National Headquarters complex opened in San Antonio, Texas.

data.name: Timeline1970_1
data.value: Our restaurants got a brand new look.

data.name: Timeline1970_2
data.value: The first Church's® franchise outside the U.S. opened in Vancouver, Canada.

data.name: Timeline1970_3
data.value: Church's® was listed on the NYSE. The Wall Street Journal called Church's® "the best-managed growth company nationwide."

data.name: Timeline1970_4
data.value: A new ad campaign clearly distinguished Church's® from competitors.

data.name: Timeline1980_1
data.value: A new advertising campaign was launched to tackle competition. The "Kick the Bucket" slogan went head-to-head with another chicken chain.

data.name: Timeline1980_2
data.value: Church's® underwent another upgrade with new brand colors: green, white, and orange.

data.name: Timeline1980_3
data.value: The brand-new Big Chicken Sandwich set a company record – nearly 1,400 sold in one day!

data.name: Timeline1990_1
data.value: We lived and believed in our true heritage – the Texas Way.

data.name: Timeline1990_2
data.value: AFC, the new parent company of Church's Chicken®, relocated Church's® headquarters to Atlanta, Georgia.

data.name: Timeline1990_3
data.value: After 12 years with AFC, Church's® was acquired by a private equity firm and no longer affiliated with any other brand.

data.name: Timeline2000_1
data.value: Global sales surpassed 1,000,000,000. That’s a lot of chicken!

data.name: Timeline2000_2
data.value: Over 60 years, Church's® has seen many rebrands, new products, and campaigns. But one thing hasn’t changed: we still serve the world’s best fried chicken!

data.name: Timeline2010_1
data.value: Our tradition is Texas. And it’s yours to savor. Every day, every bite.

data.name: Timeline2010_2
data.value: Serving customers at more than 1,700 locations in 23 countries worldwide.

data.name: Timeline2010_3
data.value: Opened Texas Chicken restaurants in Malaysia.

data.name: Timeline2020_1
data.value: With legendary meals, handcrafted flavors, and unforgettable experiences for our guests.

data.name: Timeline2020_2
data.value: Our legacy, spirit, and roots are truly Texan.

data.name: Timeline2020_3
data.value: Texas Chicken officially launched in Vietnam.
